name: The complete guide to structured and unstructured mesh reading using CGNS
description: Explore how to read and write structured and unstructured grids, along with their boundary conditions and flow data using the CGNS data format.

01_what-is-the-cgns-format-and-how-to-ge.heading: What is the CGNS format and how to get started
01_what-is-the-cgns-format-and-how-to-ge.description: Learn in this article what the CGNS file format is and how it is used in Computational Fluid Dynamics applications.

02_how-to-inspect-structured-and-unstruc.heading: How to inspect structured and unstructured grids using CGNS
02_how-to-inspect-structured-and-unstruc.description: Learn how to inspect structured and unstructured CGNS files using the tool cgnslist, the best way to quickly read the data structure stored within CGNS files.

03_how-to-set-up-a-simple-cgns-based-mes.heading: How to set up a simple CGNS-based mesh reading library
03_how-to-set-up-a-simple-cgns-based-mes.description: Learn how to create a simple C++ class structure to read any structured or unstructured grid using the CGNS file format.

04_how-to-read-a-multi-block-structured-.heading: How to read a multi-block structured mesh from a CGNS file
04_how-to-read-a-multi-block-structured-.description: Learn in this article how to read a multi-block structured grid for CFD applications using CGNS, including coordinates, interfaces, and boundary conditions.

05_how-to-read-a-multi-block-unstructure.heading: How to read a multi-block unstructured mesh from a CGNS file
05_how-to-read-a-multi-block-unstructure.description: Learn in this article how to read a multi-block unstructured grid using CGNS, including coordinates, interfaces, element connectivity and boundary conditions.

06_how-to-test-our-cgns-based-mesh-readi.heading: How to test our CGNS-based mesh reading library
06_how-to-test-our-cgns-based-mesh-readi.description: In this final article of this series, learn how to write simple tests that ensure that our CGNS-based mesh reading library code behaves exactly as intended.
